author: gstein
msg: - Teach read_info_old() about kind and depth.
- Begin a conversion of the walk_entries() functionality
(svn_wc__read_info_old): allow KIND and DEPTH to be specified in the
parameter list. fill them in from the (old) entry. If the entry isn't
found, then we should return SVN_ERR_WC_PATH_NOT_FOUND, per the
(svn_wc_walk_entries3): rename the DEPTH param to WALK_DEPTH to better
specify its purpose. use svn_wc__db_read_info() to fetch the node's
kind and depth. we still need to fetch the old entry for passing to

author: hwright
msg: Remove another entry-writing optimization by unconditionally writing the
entries file when removing an entry.
unconditionally write the new entries hash.

author: stsp
msg: Avoid using apr_off_t in unidiff parsing code. Also fixes buildbots
(parse_range): Likewise, and remove overflow check which is not needed
here anymore, unbreaking buildbots. Because apr_offset_t is not consistent
in size across platforms, a similar check will have to come back elsewhere,

author: stsp
msg: texts while parsing the hunk. Also, allow for characters after the
trailing @@ in the hunk header, as this may be used for things like
C function names, and should be accepted as valid.
